FuncDef:
The lsp-loopback start command enables loopback detection for a specified static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP on a transit node.
The lsp-loopback stop command disables loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP.
By default, loopback detection for a specified static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP on a transit node is not enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies to enable loopback detection for a specified static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP on a transit node.
-

Specifies to disable loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP, run the lsp-loopback start command on a transit node. The command output helps diagnose minor packet loss and bit errors on the static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP. After the lsp-loopback start command is run, the loopback detection-enabled node loops traffic back to the ingress through a temporary loop, which adversely affects traffic transmission. After you locate faults, immediately run the lsp-loopback stop command to disable loopback detection to restore service transmission.
